en.title: Your divorce
en.name: Name
en.respondToApplication: Respond to your {{ session.divorceWho }}'s divorce application
en.getDecreeNisi: Your {{ session.divorceWho }} applies for a decree nisi
en.readMore: Read more about the decree nisi
en.orderForDivorce: The court order for divorce (known as a decree) is made in 2 stages. You’re only divorced once both stages are complete.
en.courtAgrees: The 'decree nisi', which shows that the court agrees that you’re entitled to a divorce.
en.cannotBeMade6Weeks: The ‘decree absolute’, which legally ends the marriage. It cannot be made until at least 6 weeks after the decree nisi.
en.untilTheCecreeAbsolute: The court can cancel (legally known as rescind) the decree nisi at any time up until the decree absolute, if it's presented with new evidence showing why you shouldn’t be given a divorce.
en.decreeNisiLink: Decree nisi
en.decreeAbsoluteLink: Decree absolute
en.childrenAndDivorceLink: Children and divorce
en.moneyAndPropertyLinky: Money and property
